description:
Computes the normalized difference for two bands. The normalized difference is computed as *(band1 - band2) / (band1 + band2)*.

Each of the parameters expects a raster data cube with exactly one band. The process returns a raster data cube with exactly one band that holds the computed values. For ease of use the newly created band should be named `normalized_difference`.

This process could be used for a number of remote sensing indices such as:

* [NDVI](https://eos.com/ndvi/)
* [NDWI](https://eos.com/ndwi/)
* [NDSI](https://eos.com/ndsi/)

Please note that some back-ends may have native processes such as the `NDVI`Â process available for convenience.

band1.description: A raster data cube with exactly one band to be used as first band.

band2.description: A raster data cube with exactly one band to be used as second band.

returns.description: A raster data cube with exactly one band (preferably named `normalized_difference`) that holds the computed values.
